net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.dialog

Class AbstractDialogManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.component.base.AbstractComponent
      • net.sf.mmm.util.component.base.AbstractLoggableComponent
        • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.dialog.AbstractDialogManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DialogManager
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DialogManagerImplGwt

    public abstract class AbstractDialogManager
extends AbstractLoggableComponent
implements DialogManager
    This is the abstract base implementation of DialogManager.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

      • doInitialize

        protected void doInitialize()
        This method performs the actual initialization. It is called when AbstractComponent.initialize() is invoked for the first time.
        ATTENTION:
        When you override this method from a sub-class you need to do a super.AbstractComponent.doInitialize().
        Overrides:
        doInitialize in class AbstractLoggableComponent

      • initialize

        public void initialize(DialogPlace defaultDialogPlace)
        This method initializes this DialogManager. It opens the first dialog according to the initial DialogPlace that may be provided by the user e.g. from a bookmark. If no DialogPlace is given by the user, the defaultPlace is opened.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface DialogManager
        Parameters:
        defaultDialogPlace - is the DialogPlace of the start Dialog to open as default.

      • getCurrentPlace

        public DialogPlace getCurrentPlace()
        This method gets the current DialogPlace.
        Specified by:
        getCurrentPlace in interface DialogManager
        Returns:
        the current DialogPlace. Will be null until DialogManager.initialize(DialogPlace) has been called.

      • getStartPlace

        protected abstract DialogPlace getStartPlace()
        This method determines the start DialogPlace. If the application is started from a bookmark, this method will create the DialogPlace from this bookmark (in case of a web-application from the hash of the URL).
        Returns:
        the start DialogPlace or null if not present (and default shall be used.
        See Also:
        initialize(DialogPlace)

      • getDialog

        public DialogController<?> getDialog(String dialogId)
                              throws ObjectNotFoundException
        This method gets the Dialog with the given ID.
        Specified by:
        getDialog in interface DialogManager
        Parameters:
        dialogId - the ID of the requested Dialog.
        Returns:
        the requested Dialog.
        Throws:
        ObjectNotFoundException - if no Dialog with the given dialogId.

      • getCurrentDialog

        public Dialog getCurrentDialog(String type)
        This method gets the current Dialog of the given type. If multiple Dialogs of the same type are open at a time, this method will return the one in the front.
        Specified by:
        getCurrentDialog in interface DialogManager
        Parameters:
        type - is the type of the requested Dialog.
        Returns:
        the current Dialog with the given type or null if no such Dialog is visible.

      • getCurrentMainDialog

        public Dialog getCurrentMainDialog()
        This method gets the current Dialog of the type main.
        Specified by:
        getCurrentMainDialog in interface DialogManager
        Returns:
        the current Dialog.

      • getCurrentPopupDialog

        public PopupDialog getCurrentPopupDialog()
        This method gets the current PopupDialog. If multiple PopupDialogs are open, it will return the top-level one.
        ATTENTION:
        Beside a PopupDialog there can also be simple popups that are NOT considered by this method.
        Specified by:
        getCurrentPopupDialog in interface DialogManager
        Returns:
        the current PopupDialog or null if no PopupDialog is currently open.

      • onShowDialog

        void onShowDialog(Dialog dialog)
        This method has to be called whenever a Dialog is opened or brought to the front.
        Parameters:
        dialog - the current Dialog.

      • onHideDialog

        void onHideDialog(Dialog dialog)
        This method should be called whenever a Dialog is hidden.
        Parameters:
        dialog - the Dialog to hide.

      • navigateTo

        public final void navigateTo(String dialogId)
        This is a convenience method for navigateTo(new DialogPlace(dialogId)).
        ATTENTION:
        It is best practice NOT to use this method. See DialogPlace for further details.
        Specified by:
        navigateTo in interface DialogManager
        Parameters:
        dialogId - is the ID of the dialog to open.

      • show

        protected void show(DialogPlace dialogPlace)
        Parameters:
        dialogPlace - is the DialogPlace to show.
        See Also:
        DialogManager.navigateTo(DialogPlace)

      • verifyUniqueAccessKeys

        private boolean verifyUniqueAccessKeys()
        Returns:
        always true.
        See Also:
        UiAccessKeyBinding.verifyUniqueAccessKeys()

      • getTitle

        protected String getTitle(DialogController<?> dialogController)
        This method determines the title for the given DialogController.
        Parameters:
        dialogController - is the DialogController.
        Returns:
        the calculated title.
